list_definition.definition: to hear (what one was not intended to hear)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She overheard two people talking in the next room.

list_ex_of_english: Peripheral participants are more likely to benefit from overhearing the primary participants if the people conversing know they are there and design their utterances appropriately.
She argues that mastering first and second person pronouns is facilitated by overhearing, and understanding, third parties using these pronouns.
It was overheard by the ostler who confided it to other customers.
Their talk is, however, available to be overheard by other pupils, although initially no other pupil is a ratified listener.
First, they show that they overheard the prior exchange by producing further talk about the weather.
Actual readers become like eavesdroppers who overhear a conversation that is not really meant for their hopelessly-biased ears.
Several pharmacy users commented on the knowledge and training of the pharmacists, although most also remarked about the difficulties of being overheard in the queue.
What matters in architects' writings - as in their design work - are those moments when we sense that we are overhearing a conversation.
